entries.label: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
Ministry Of New and Renewable Energy
Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
Ministry of Women and Child Development
Ministry Of Skill Development And Entrepreneurship
Ministry Of Personnel, Public Grievances And Pensions
Ministry Of Petroleum and Natural Gas
Comptroller And Auditor General Of India
Ministry Of Environment,forests and climate change
Ministry Of Consumer Affairs, Food And Public Distribution
Ministry Of Development Of North Eastern Region
Ministry Of Statistics and Programme Implementation
NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India)

fields.schemeName: Marriage Grant for the Marriage of Daughters of Widows of Ex-servicemen (other than War Widows)
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹11,000/- is provided to the widows of ex-servicemen (other than war widows) for the marriage of their daughters, for up to two daughters who are at least 18 years old.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Anusuchit Jati Evam Anusuchit Janjati Chhatrawas Anudan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The “Mukhyamantri Anusoochit Jaati Evam Anusoochit Janajati Chhatrawas Anudan Yojana” was launched by the SC and ST Welfare Department, Government of Bihar aims to provide financial assistance in every month to the students studying in Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe hostels.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Celebration of Birth/death Anniversary of Eminent Personalities
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme for Celebration of Birth/Death Anniversary of Eminent Personalities" scheme aims to provide financial assistance for the celebration of anniversaries/Jayanti's of Sant Kabir, Sant Gadge, and Sant Durbalnath and in addition to Anniversaries of DR. B.R. Ambedkar, etc.

fields.schemeName: Maintenance Of Pregnant Desi/Indigenous Cow/Buffalo Ration Scheme For BPL Families Belonging To Scheduled Caste (SC) Category
fields.briefDescription: A scheme had been launched by the Department of Animal Husbandry, Government of Himachal Pradesh with the aim to provides a 50% subsidy on a balanced ration for pregnant cows or buffalo during the last trimester of pregnancy.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Comptroller And Auditor General Of India
fields.schemeName: International Centre for Environment Audit and Sustainable Development (iCED)
fields.briefDescription: The "International Centre for Environment Audit and Sustainable Development (iCED)" scheme provides a platform to young students pursuing courses in Ocean Science, Environmental Science, Environment Management, Environment Audit, etc. to help develop awareness about the work of iCED with special.

fields.schemeName: Marketing Development Assistance Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Marketing Development Assistance (MDA) Scheme under the Overseas Promotion & Publicity (OPP) Scheme aims to support the promotion and marketing of Indian tourism in overseas markets.

fields.schemeName: Pratibha Yojana
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides financial assistance to Scheduled Tribe students who have passed national competitive examinations such as JEE, NEET, CLAT, AIIMS, and NDA, and have taken admission in IIT, NIT, NLU, MBBS (government colleges located in Madhya Pradesh), AIIMS or NDA.

fields.schemeName: Medical Expenses for Treatment of Major Ailments (O.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: The “Medical Expenses for Treatment of Major Ailments” scheme by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha, is a welfare scheme that provides financial assistance for the treatment of beneficiary or his/ her dependents suffering from major diseases.

fields.schemeName: Maternity Benefit (O.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: The “Maternity Benefit” scheme by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha, is a welfare scheme that provides maternity benefits to the female beneficiaries subject to a maximum of two children who  are registered beneficiaries for a period of more than one year under the board.

fields.schemeName: State Marriage Assistance Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The 'State Marriage Assistance Scheme' offers one-time financial aid to female beneficiaries from families holding AAY or PHH ration cards, with the amount directly credited to their Aadhaar-linked bank accounts. Additionally, divyangjan beneficiaries also receive financial assistance.

fields.schemeName: Nalkoop Khanan Yojana- Madhya Pradesh
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, farmers from SC and ST categories are eligible for a subsidy covering 75% of the unit cost (up to ₹25,000/-) for digging a tube well and 75% of the unit cost (up to ₹15,000/-) for the successful installation of a tube well submersible pump.

fields.schemeName: Assistance for Purchase of Safety Equipment (O.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: The “Assistance for Purchase of Safety Equipment” scheme by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha, is a welfare scheme that provides one time reimbursement to each registered beneficiary of the Board for purchasing Safety Equipment like Helmet, Safety shoes and Hand-gloves.

fields.schemeName: Rehabilitation of Cured Leprosy Persons: Pre & Post-Matric Scholarship
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to the parents of Cured Leprosy Persons in order to support such parents in successfully bringing up their children against societal intolerance, stigma, discrimination and violence.

fields.schemeName: KALIA Scholarship
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to extend financial assistance to the children of the beneficiaries under KALIA for pursuing Professional/Technical courses in the State of Odisha.

fields.schemeName: Grant for the Purchase of Working Tools (O.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Grant for the Purchase of Working Tools” by the BOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha, is a welfare scheme that provides one-time reimbursement to each registered beneficiary of the Board for purchasing tools.

fields.schemeName: Vidyasiri food And Accommodation Scholarship Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Vidyasiri-Food and Accommodation Scholarship Scheme (VFAS) is a government initiative in Karnataka that provides financial assistance to students belonging to backward classes pursuing post-matric courses in recognized institutions. Scheme offers a monthly stipend of Rs. 1,500 for10 months

fields.schemeName: Kailash Mansarovar Yatra- Madhya Pradesh
fields.briefDescription: This scheme aims to provide financial assistance to the pilgrims of the state going on the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra. Under this scheme, the State Government will reimburse 50% of the total expenses incurred during the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra, up to a maximum of ₹30,000/- per pilgrim.

fields.schemeName: Mahila Nirman Shramik Vivah Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Mahila Nirman Shramik Vivah Yojana" was launched by the Tripura Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, under the Labour Department of Tripura. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to registered female construction workers and maximum of two of their daughters.

fields.schemeName: Mamata Scheme
fields.briefDescription: In order to improve the process in curbing the high rate of mortality and infant mortality rate, the Department of Women and Child Development, Government of Odisha introduced a scheme named "MAMATA" - a conditional cash transfer maternity benefit scheme.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Kalakar Sahayata Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Mukhyamantri Kalakar Sahayata Yojana is a scheme under the Odia Language, Literature & Culture Department, Government of Odisha aims to offer sustenance and assistance to elderly artists who, despite facing financial hardship, have consistently devoted themselves to enriching culture of the state.

fields.schemeName: Student Housing Scheme for Students with Disabilities
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, there is a provision to provide free housing facilities to a group of 5 disabled students, to motivate them for higher education, by providing accommodations to them. The accommodations are provided at a rental building.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme- Chhattisgarh
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹500/- is provided to severely disabled (with a disability of 80% and above) and multi-disabled individuals aged 18 to 79 years who are living below the poverty line (BPL) to support them in living a respectful life.

fields.schemeName: Disabled State Level Award Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to encourage persons with disabilities and organizations working for the interests of persons with disabilities and to motivate the community for overall rehabilitation of persons with disabilities.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Gift Scheme - Telangana
fields.briefDescription: The "Marriage Gift Scheme" was launched by the Telangana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, LET&F (Labour) Dept. Telangana. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance as a marriage gift to unmarried registered women workers & the daughters of registered building & construction

fields.schemeName: Fatal Accident Relief - Telangana
fields.briefDescription: The "Fatal Accident Relief" scheme is a welfare initiative by the Telangana Government aimed at providing financial support to the nominee, dependents, or legal heirs of registered building and other construction workers in the unfortunate event of their accidental death.

fields.schemeName: Social Security Pension Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹500/- is provided to Below Poverty Line (BPL) Persons with Disabilities (PwDs) and dwarf individuals to support them in living a respectful life.

fields.schemeName: Skill Development Training - 90 Days Residential Skill Development Training Programme
fields.briefDescription: The Telangana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board offers a 90-day residential skill development training program designed for unemployed youth who are dependents of registered construction workers.

fields.schemeName: Kalinga Sikhya Sathi Yojana
fields.briefDescription: "Kalinga Sikhya Sathi Yojana (KSSY)" is an Educational Loan Scheme by the Department of Higher Education, Government of Odisha with the aim to bring down the financial burden on the parents of students who want to move forward with higher education.

fields.schemeName: Stipend Scheme (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: The "Stipend Scheme'' scheme by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that provides financial support as stipend for the education of children of registered construction workers, including hostel fees, and extends to evening classes for the workers themselves.

fields.schemeName: Cycle Scheme for the Children of Construction Workers (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: The "Cycle Scheme for the Children of Construction Workers'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that provides free cycles to the children of registered construction workers once during the period they study in 9th to 12th class in the State of Punjab.

fields.schemeName: Skill Upgradation and Vocational Education Scheme: For Worker's Childrens (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: "Skill Upgradation and Vocational Education Scheme: For Worker's Children'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Dept. of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that provides full course fees, boarding and lodging assistance to the children of registered workers who acquire Skill from technical institutions.

fields.schemeName: One Time Financial Support for Economically Weaker Meritorious ST Students
fields.briefDescription: The "One Time Financial Support for Economically Weaker Meritorious ST Students" scheme aims to provide financial assistance ₹1,00,000/- to the economically weaker meritorious schedule tribe students to pursue different professional & other courses in government-recognized institutes/colleges.

fields.schemeName: Old Age Pension Scheme (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: The "Old Age Pension Scheme'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that provides pension to registered construction workers aged above 60 years and have completed 3 years of membership with the Board.

fields.schemeName: Shagun Scheme (P.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: The "Shagun Scheme'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Punjab, is a welfare scheme that provides financial support for the marriage of up to two daughters of registered workmen, including daughters who are registered beneficiaries.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri - Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Mukhyamantri - Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana" is for the economic freedom of women in the state age group of 21 to 65, improving their health and nutrition and strengthening their decisive role in the family. The women will receive a financial benefit through direct benefit transfer.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: The NSFDC Internship Scheme
fields.briefDescription: "The NSFDC Internship Scheme 2024" is implemented by the National Scheduled Castes Finance & Development Corporation, Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt. of India. The internship will expose students to various programs & schemes undertaken by NSFDC, offering them hands-on experience in

fields.schemeName: Distribution of Manually Operated Plant Protection Equipment
fields.briefDescription: The "Distribution of Manually Operated Plant Protection Equipment" scheme provides farmers with a subsidy of 50% on the cost of equipment to enhance agricultural practices.

fields.schemeName: Rajarshri Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj Merit Scholarship
fields.briefDescription: The "Rajarshri Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj Merit Scholarship" is an initiative by the Maharashtra Government, specifically designed to encourage scheduled caste students to pursue higher secondary education.  The scholarship aims to enhance the educational standards & competitiveness of students.

fields.schemeName: Incentive Scheme for Sericulture Reelers
fields.briefDescription: The "Incentive Scheme for Sericulture Reelers" is aimed at improving the financial condition of minority communities involved in silk reeling and spinning. The corporation will provide loans to support working capital and basic infrastructure for silk spinners.

fields.schemeName: Distribution of Rhizobium Packets-Oilseeds
fields.briefDescription: The “Distribution of Rhizobium Packets-Oilseeds” scheme provides a subsidy on the cost of Rhizobium, to eligible farmers who produce and supply Foundation and Certified Class seeds.

fields.schemeName: Sikhligar’s Community Development Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Sikhligar’s Community Development Scheme" aims to promote economic self-reliance among the Sikhligara community, the Corporation will provide a subsidy and a subsidy of 33% of the vehicle cost for purchasing goods tempos, or vehicles to economically backward of Karnataka state.

fields.schemeName: Shramashakthi Special Women's Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Shramashakthi Special Women's Scheme" is a special scheme for the economic empowerment of widowed, divorced, unmarried women of the minority community.

fields.schemeName: Kabir Anthyesthi Anudan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a one-time grant of ₹3,000/- is given to the family/dependent of the deceased to cover funeral expenses. The grant is provided for the death of any person of any age from a Below Poverty Line (BPL) family.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme- Bihar
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹400/- is provided to widows in the age group of 40 to 79 years who belong to Below Poverty Line (BPL) families to support them financially. This scheme is centrally sponsored.

fields.schemeName: Livelihood Support To Marine Fishermen During Fishing Ban Period
fields.briefDescription: Livelihood Support to Marine Fishermen during the Fishing Ban Period scheme under the Department of Fisheries & Animal Resources Development, Government of Odisha aims to support the livelihood of marine fisher families.

fields.schemeName: Integrated Pest Management Demonstration Cum Training
fields.briefDescription: The “Integrated Pest Management Demonstration Cum Training” scheme provides financial assistance for 30 farmers to conduct pest management demonstrations and training using a cluster approach in Farmer Field Schools.

fields.schemeName: Marriage Assistance (K.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: The "Marriage Assistance'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Karnataka, is a welfare scheme that provides financial support to registered construction workers for the marriage expenses of their own or their two (2) dependent children's marriages.

fields.schemeName: Distribution of Minikits At Free of Cost
fields.briefDescription: The "Distribution of Minikits at Free of Cost" scheme provides subsidies for minikits to maize-growing farmers in some of the selected districts of Tamil Nadu.

fields.schemeName: Pension Scheme (K.B.O.C.W.W.B)
fields.briefDescription: The "Pension Scheme'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Karnataka, is a welfare scheme that aims to provide a monthly pension to registered construction workers who have reached 60 years of age and is a beneficiary of the Board for at least 3 years.

fields.schemeName: Production of Foundation and Certified Seeds
fields.briefDescription: The "Production of Foundation and Certified Seeds" scheme, provides subsidy to farmers who produce and supply Foundation and Certified seeds to the Department of Agriculture.

fields.schemeName: Organizing Block Demonstration
fields.briefDescription: The “Organizing Block Demonstration” scheme provides a 50% subsidy or ₹2,000/- (whichever is less) on input costs for demonstrating the cultivation of Pulses crops over 5 hectares.

fields.schemeName: Disability Pension (BBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: Under the scheme, eligible workers receive ₹1,000/- per month for permanent disabilities caused by conditions such as paralysis, leprosy, tuberculosis, or accidents. Additionally, a one-time assistance of ₹75,000/- is granted for total permanent disability, and ₹50,000/- for partial disability.

fields.schemeName: Kayaka Spoorthi Scheme Karnataka
fields.briefDescription: The "Kayaka Spoorthi Scheme" aims to provide financial assistance to women Self-Help Groups (SHGs) engaged in the leather industry. The goal is to promote self-sufficiency and economic independence by enabling these women to start or expand business activities related to leatherwork.

fields.schemeName: Visit of Contract Farming Farmers to the Research Stations in Karnataka
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Visit of Contract Farming Farmers to the Research Stations in Karnataka” facilitates visits for contract farming farmers to research stations across Karnataka to gain agricultural knowledge. Financial support is provided for a 3-day visit.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Relief to the Un-registered Workers
fields.briefDescription: The Andhra Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board launched a welfare scheme "Scheme for Relief for the Un-registered Workers" to provide the financial assistance to the dependents of unregistered workers who die in accidents at construction sites.

fields.schemeName: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department-Hostels: Special Guides
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides hostel facilities to all boys and girls boarders studying up to XII Standard.

fields.schemeName: Training of Farmers on Pulses Production Technologies
fields.briefDescription: The “Training of Farmers on Pulses Production Technologies” scheme aims to educate farmers on advanced pulses production technologies to enhance crop yield.

fields.schemeName: Production of Certified Seeds of Maize
fields.briefDescription: The "Production of Certified Seeds of Maize" scheme, aims to promote the production of certified maize seeds by providing subsidy to farmers in select districts of Tamil Nadu.

fields.schemeName: Production of Foundation Seeds
fields.briefDescription: The "Production of Foundation Seeds" scheme, provides subsidies to farmers cultivating seed farms for pulses, offering specific benefits to SC/ST farmers and farm women.

fields.schemeName: Pension Scheme (BBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme is implemented by the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. Under this scheme, registered construction workers who have completed a minimum of five years of membership and have attained the age of 60 are eligible for a pension of ₹1,000/- per month.

fields.schemeName: Padhuke Kuteera Scheme Karnataka
fields.briefDescription: The "Paduke Kuteera Scheme" provides roadside cobblers engaged in repair work or footwear production with a steel-made kiosk (Paduke Kuteera) and a tool kit free of cost. The unit cost of each Kuteera is ₹1,25,000, and the scheme includes a signage board display arrangement.

fields.schemeName: Direct Loan Scheme Karnataka
fields.briefDescription: The "Direct Loan Scheme" offers financial assistance to unemployed scheduled caste individuals from the leather artisan community to start small businesses.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Education of Children of Beneficiary
fields.briefDescription: The "Financial Assistance for Education of Children of Beneficiary" welfare scheme launched by the Manipur Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board provides one-time financial assistance for the education of children.

fields.schemeName: Skill Development Training Manipur
fields.briefDescription: The Manipur Building and Other Construction Workers' Welfare Board offers "Skill Development Training" to registered building workers, their spouse, dependent siblings, and children. The training includes vocational and skill development courses from recognized government and private providers.

fields.schemeName: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department: Scholarship-Free Education upto 12th Std. to All
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides free education for Adi Dravidar, Tribal and Adi Dravidar (Converted to Christianity) students up to 12th standard, covering tuition fees, which are reimbursed by the government.

fields.schemeName: Awards to Bright Students
fields.briefDescription: The "Awards to Bright Students" scheme offers financial assistance to the top two boys and two girls from Adi Dravidar/Tribal/Adi Dravidar Converted to Christianity in each district who have excelled in their 10th standard public examinations and continue their studies.

fields.schemeName: Annal Gandhi Memorial Award
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to one boy and one girl from the SC/ST community (Hindu Adi Dravidar) in each district who secure the first rank in plus 2 Public Examinations.

fields.schemeName: Incentive for the Inter Caste Marriage Couple
fields.briefDescription: The Social Welfare Department of the Government of Karnataka has launched the "Incentive for the Inter Caste Marriage Couple", which offers incentives to couples belonging to the SC community and Non-SC. The scheme aims to promote inter-caste marriages and provide financial assistance to the couples

fields.schemeName: Construction of Free Houses for Tribals
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides free houses to tribals who already possess free house site pattas. The construction of the houses is carried out by government authorities, ensuring shelter for tribal communities.

fields.schemeName: Maternity Benefit For Female Workers- JKBOCWWB
fields.briefDescription: The "Maternity Benefit for Female Workers" scheme by the JKBOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, Jammu & Kashmir, is a welfare program that provides maternity benefits to eligible registered female workers up to two times in their lifetime.

fields.schemeName: District Central Cooperative Banks and through its Branches: For Professional Loan to Doctors, Engineers and Self Employed Professional
fields.briefDescription: This scheme provides professional loans to doctors, engineers, and self-employed professionals through District Central Cooperative Banks. The maximum loan amount is ₹10,00,000 at an interest rate of 13% (subject to change).

fields.schemeName: Registered BOC Workers in case of an Accidental Death (JKBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The "Registered BOC Workers in Case of Accidental Death" scheme by the JKBOCW Welfare Board, Labour Department, Jammu & Kashmir, provides financial assistance to the nominee or dependents of registered BOC workers in the event of accidental death.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Widow or Widower of Registered Construction Worker
fields.briefDescription: The scheme is implemented by the Maharashtra Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹24,000/- p.a. up to 5 years to the widow or widower in case of death of a registered worker during the course of employment.

fields.schemeName: Medical Assistance for the Treatment of Critical Illness
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, medical assistance of ₹1,00,000/- for the treatment of serious ailments for registered worker and his/her family members. (the benefit can be availed only after 26th July 2014 as the benefit is covered under the Mediclaim & Personal Accident Insurance scheme).

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for Normal Delivery and Surgical Delivery
fields.briefDescription: The "Financial Assistance for Normal Delivery and Surgical Delivery" scheme was launched by the Maharashtra Building And Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (MBOCWW), Labour Department Maharashtra.

fields.schemeName: Medical Assistance (NBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The "Medical Assistance" scheme by the Nagaland Building and Other Construction Workers' Welfare Board provides financial assistance to registered beneficiaries and their family members for hospitalization.

fields.schemeName: Endeavour To Empower-Skill Development
fields.briefDescription: Endeavour to Empower is a customized skill development programme for the youth of J&K.

fields.schemeName: Postmatric Scholarship
fields.briefDescription: The scheme offers financial assistance to Backward Classes (BC), Most Backward Classes (MBC) students studying in 11th and 12th standard in English Medium schools. It covers tuition fees and examination fees to promote education among students from economically weaker backgrounds.

fields.schemeName: Primary Cooperative Agriculture and Rural Development Bank: For Minor Irrigation
fields.briefDescription: The scheme offers loans to farmers for minor irrigation projects, aiming to enhance water access for agriculture. Loan amounts range from ₹65,000/- to ₹1,20,000/- at an interest rate of 11% to 11.75%.

fields.schemeName: Primary Cooperative Agriculture and Rural Development Bank: For Plantation (Tea)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme offers financial assistance of up to ₹33,000/- per acre to farmers for tea plantations, with an interest rate of 11%-12.5%.

fields.schemeName: Primary Cooperative Agriculture and Rural Development Bank: For Horticulture
fields.briefDescription: The scheme offers a horticulture loan to support farmers with funds ranging from ₹25,000/- to ₹2,00,000/- per 0.4 hectare at an interest rate of 11%-12.75%.

fields.schemeName: Savitribai Phule Self-Help Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial support to unemployed women from the Scheduled Caste (SC) category in the state to help them start businesses in industry, service, or trade sectors.

fields.schemeName: Training Centre for Specially-Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The Training Centre for Specially-Abled Persons scheme offers vocational courses for specially-abled individuals, funded by the Government of Mizoram. The centers provide courses in tailoring for females and tailoring/shoemaking for males, with a monthly stipend of ₹250 for the training period.

fields.schemeName: Long Term-Loan to SC Co-op Spinning Mills under Special Component Plan
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Long Term-Loan to SC Co-op Spinning Mills under Special Component Plan" was introduced by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra. The scheme aims to promote the development of spinning mills owned by scheduled caste members.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Bagwani Mission: Dragon Fruit Vikas Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to expand dragon fruit cultivation in 21 districts of the state, providing financial assistance to ryot farmers for establishing and maintaining dragon fruit plantations.

fields.schemeName: West Bengal Transport Workers’ Social Security Scheme: Assistance on Hospitalization
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to transport workers who are hospitalized for 5 or more days due to an accident.

fields.schemeName: Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme (Jammu and Kashmir)
fields.briefDescription: Launched on 15th August 1995, the scheme "National Social Assistance Programme" is a welfare scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Union Territory of Jammu & Kashmir. It provides monthly financial aid of ₹1,000/- to widows aged 40 years and above who belong to Below Poverty Line (BPL) households.

fields.schemeName: Mahila Kisan Yojana (Maharashtra)
fields.briefDescription: "Mahila Kisan Yojana" is implemented by the Dept. of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Govt. of Maharashtra. The scheme aims to uplift the lifestyle of economically disadvantaged Charmakar communities. it supports the production and sale of various types of footwear and leather articles.

fields.schemeName: Incentive For The Inter Caste Marriage Couple (Scheduled Tribe)
fields.briefDescription: The "Incentive for Inter Caste Marriage Couple" scheme was launched by the Tribal Welfare Department, Karnataka. The scheme provides incentives to the couple in which one spouse is from a Scheduled Tribe (ST) and the other spouse is non-ST. An incentive of ₹5,50,000/- is provided to the couple.

fields.schemeName: Stipend to Educated Unemployed
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, provides a stipend of ₹650 per month to assist 25 educated persons with disabilities who have registered in an Employment Exchange for over three years and have not been placed in gainful employment.

fields.schemeName: Handicapped Students Stipend Mizoram
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, provide financial support to differently-abled students for purchasing essential items like books and uniforms. Students enrolled in both government and private schools are eligible to receive a monthly stipend.

fields.schemeName: Internship Scheme Of The Department Of Economic Affairs
fields.briefDescription: The Department of Economic Affairs of the Ministry of Finance manages the Internship Scheme for PhD or postgraduate students working on specific issues relating to macroeconomic management, capital Markets, Economic Reforms, Exchange Management, Foreign Investment in India, etc.

fields.schemeName: Grant For Organizing Conference
fields.briefDescription: The "Grant for Organizing Conference (GOC)" scheme by AICTE provides financial assistance to institutions for organizing conferences in various fields of technical education. Both Onsite Conferences and Online Conferences are supported.

fields.schemeName: Scheme For Loan And Advances to the Beneficiary For Construction Of House
fields.briefDescription: The Scheme for Loan and Advances to the Beneficiary for Construction of House was launched by the Tripura Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, under the Labour Department of Tripura.

fields.schemeName: State Scholarship of Class 1st to 5th (Scheduled Caste)
fields.briefDescription: Launched in 1966-67, the "State Scholarship of Class 1st to 5th" scheme is a welfare initiative by the Scheduled Caste Welfare Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh. The scheme provides a scholarship amount of ₹200/- to Scheduled Caste students, which is disbursed until 31st October every year.

fields.schemeName: Krishi Input Anudan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide agricultural input subsidies in affected areas due to the rise in water levels of rivers like Ganga and Kosi and flood-related crop damage from heavy rainfall.

fields.schemeName: Self-Certification Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Labour Department, Government of Tripura, launched the Self-Certification Scheme aims for employers to self-certify their compliance with multiple labor laws, aiming to simplify inspections and reduce bureaucracy.

fields.schemeName: Deen Dayal Upadhyay Kaushal Kendra (DDUKK)- Mega Skill Centre
fields.briefDescription: The “Deen Dayal Upadhyay Kaushal Kendra (DDUKK)- Mega Skill Centre” is a component of the umbrella scheme “Mukhymantri Sarthi Yojna” launched by the Department of Labour, Employment, Training and Skill Development, Government of Jharkhand.

fields.schemeName: Vadh Se Bachaye Govansh Ko Sahayata Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Vadh Se Bachaye Govansh Ko Sahayata Yojana" scheme, initiated by the Directorate of Gopalan on 02/07/2015, provides financial assistance for the care and maintenance of cattle rescued from illegal slaughter or smuggling.

fields.schemeName: Sarvajan Pension Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance of per month to elderly individuals, widows, destitute women, differently-abled persons, primitive tribes, and HIV/AIDS patients. The scheme eliminates previous age restrictions and targets inclusivity by guaranteeing pensions to all eligible.
